intro: Bafutia tenuicaulis var. zapfackiana, commonly known as the slender-stemmed bafutia, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It is characterized by its thin, elongated stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. The plant produces delicate, pale yellow flowers during the dry season, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
